text.text_translated: Genes are units of information in our bodies. Scientists are still asking questions about them and how they influence our brains and how we develop language. They also want to know if specific changes in these genes made us able to use language. A mutation is a change in a gene. Researchers have found a mutation in one of these genes. This change happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. It seems to be linked to speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It is too early to say how much these genes affect language. But one day the answers might be found in our DNA. DNA is the material in our bodies that carries information about how we are made.
